intro: Barleria violascens var. humpatana, commonly known as the Humpatana barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in spikes, and display a range of colors from pink to violet. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats.
